intro: Clematis cylindrica var. eriostemon, commonly known as the slender clematis, is a climbing vine native to eastern Asia. It features slender, wiry stems that can grow up to 10 meters in length, often twining around supports. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers in shades of white to pale blue, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are simple, ovate, and often have a hairy texture. It prefers well-drained soil and full sun to partial shade, making it a versatile addition to gardens.
